[CFN] What the hell happened to Ohio?

Ok, 

  Normally I'm not on a rant, but since there's been no traffic on
this list for a few days and I'm stumped as to what to do next...

  Why is Ohio just simply screwed anymore?

  I'm working with a Charity, we're all 501c3 compliant and do
everything possible to comply with all the fun laws of the Feds and
Ohio, since we're based here.

  So we need to raise some funds.  Simple, right?  Not in Ohio
anymore!  We were looking to produce a simple casino-night style event
with a Raflle & Silent Auction, feed, all kinds of entertainment.  Had
everything lined up and then we get word of all these 'busts' up on
the North Coast of legitimate and illegal gambling events.

  Now I'm all for nailing those who want to twist the system in their
favor and claim to raise money for a legitimate cause and then keep it
for themselves.  String them up, end of story.

  But I spend a solid week talking with just about every 'governmental
employee' we pay to have down there with the Ohio Investigative Unit,
the Atty Generals office and a slew of others.  They give varied
opinions, then the AG spits out a new 'policy'.  Fine, we can deal
with that.

  After this new Policy hits the streets, the OIU and any other law
enforcement group that's bored gets one alleged complaint call about
an event BEFORE the event actually takes place (not us, we've
suspended things pending all this crud) and they go raid it.  Makes it
on TV, they're happy, no explanations as to why they're raiding events
that are set up legit - nothing.  There were a couple bogus ones,
that's not a problem in my personal book.

  But it's inconceivable that this 'State' has rigged things to the
point where if you're doing anything other than Bingo, a Reverse
Raffle or Silent Auction, you're now borderlining on being a felon and
they're coming after you.  We've done every last detailed step they
wanted to get in compliance - they may still show up and raid the
place for some nice bad press.  No explanations, just that even if
we're 100% in compliance we could still get nailed if someone feels
the need.

  Church group?  See ya in the slammer.  Non-Profit?  Who cares! 
That's right, Taft & Voinovich have now managed to pervert their
anti-casino mindset so far into the depths of decent society that an
honest group trying to raise funds to support athletic programs and
training for young athletes is better off handing out tin cups and
standing on the sidewalk like hookers.

  It's about this time, after way too many years of living in Ohio,
that I'm about ready to pack it up and get the hell out.

  /rant off

  Dave 'S_Falcon' (ar219)
